column4: Im having an issue with ALSA inside of WINE. When running 'winecfg' and selecting the 'Audio' tab, I recieve a dialog box stating: "Found drive in registry that is not available! Remove "alsa" from registry?" Any thoughts??
i have.. they referred me to the ubuntu channel cause they think im missing 32bit alsa libs
yes, and skype. my sound is good, just not in WINE
well it might be a packaging problem if it works on other distros but not ubuntu
didn't think wine ran at 64 bit at all - you're using a 32bit chroot?
negative. installed ia32-libs and runs. Diablo 2 + LOD (expansion) are installed, runs fine, just no sound
but also would be 64 bit libs??
but alsa would be 64 bit libs??
